lead_paragraph: Officials claimed a breakthrough in the Delhi High Court blast case that killed 15 and injured scores of others a month ago. The National Investigation Agency tasked with finding the perpetrators detained another suspect from the Kishtwar area of Jammu and Kashmir - their third arrest in the case. (Indian Express) Officials say the third suspect, identified only as Wasim, is one of the key conspirators and hatched the plot after being lured by the Harkat-ul-Jehadi Islami in Bangladesh. Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Thursday once again dismissed a demand from the main state opposition party that he step down from office after the death of a party worker stoked controversy. (The Hindu) The People's Democratic Party says Mr. Abdullah may "influence" the judicial inquiry into the death, which he denies.

headline.main: Newswallah: What's in the English-Language Press Friday
